User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Clicked a mailto link when Gmail is default email. 


Actual results:

Nothing! This used to work with previous versions of FF. Problem is consistent across various websites and repeatable every time. 
I have tested the specified link (https://mail.google.com/mail/?extsrc=mailto&url=%s) manually and it works fine. The same link invoked with FF5 fails and no error message is displayed. I am not aware of any changes that would impact this other than upgrading to FF5.


Expected results:

Gmail compose mail window should have opened.

As far as I know, Firefox does not have builtin support for redirecting
mailto: links to a gmail web page in the browser.  Maybe you have
installed an add-on that added that functionality?  (check Tools->Add-ons)
If so, I suspect that add-on is incompatible with Firefox 5 and that's
why it stopped working.

comments.raw_text:
I have narrowed the source of the problem down a little. 

The problem appears to be somewhere in prefs.js. I can copy all other files from my original default profile to the new profile without losing the mailto via Gmail capability but as soon as I copy across prefs.js it fails as previously described.

I am totally new to the internal workings of FF and so I am now out of my depth. Also this does not explain the secondary issue with the new profile whereby a mailto link opens the Gmail compose mail window in the same tab as the web page rather than a new browser window as before.

It seems something got out of whack with the upgrade to FF5. And I'm not alone; for more cases/reports see:
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/questions/846879?s=mailto+link+and+gmail&as=s
